description.raw:
**This is mainly here to remind me to finish testing this**

Added tentative support for the Cicero pseudoclock that uses an Opal Kelly XEM3001 FPGA development board.

Firmware \(.bit files\) for the FPGA are available from [https://bitbucket.org/labscript\_suite/opalkellyxem3001/](#!/labscript_suite/opalkellyxem3001) and should be placed in the labscript\_devices folder for this to work. You also need to install the Opal Kelly SDK, which provides python bindings, and these Python bindings will need to be manually copied into the site-packages of any virtual environments you want to run BLACS from.

Things that need more testing:

* Using the external reference
* The inbuilt wait monitor
* That it can be substituted for another pseudoclock and the experiment sequence still has the same result \(aka, I’ve implemented it correctly!\)

You also need to install the Opal Kelly SDK, which provides python bindings, and these Python bindings will need to be manually copied into the site-packages of any virtual environments you want to run BLACS from.
